etymologies: Middle English: from Old French safran, based on Arabic za‘farān

definitions: an orange-yellow flavoring, food coloring, and dye made from the dried stigmas of a crocus
shortDefinitions: orange-yellow flavouring, food colouring, and dye made from dried stigmas of crocus

examples.text: the saffron robe of a Buddhist monk

definitions: an autumn-flowering crocus with reddish-purple flowers, native to warmer regions of Eurasia. Enormous numbers of flowers are required to produce a small quantity of the large red stigmas used for the spice.

notes.text: Crocus sativus, family Iridaceae. See also meadow saffron

shortDefinitions: autumn-flowering crocus with reddish-purple flowers, native to warmer regions of Eurasia
